revised_title: Mathematical Foundations of Music Theory and Instrument Tuning
tldr: The author presents a method for setting up musical instruments with precise mathematical proportions to create perfect harmonies. They demonstrate this by tuning two violins and performing a Sonata, proving that the theory aligns with both modern practice and ancient Greek music. The author also explains how to divide notes into chromatic half-notes and suggests that further research could lead to the recovery of even smaller intervals used by ancient musicians.
